meanings.definition: A person who asserts their opinions in an arrogant or stubborn manner.
meanings.sent1: Some dogmatists refuse to consider other viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The group of dogmatists at the meeting dominated the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The dogmatists were so sure of their ideas, they wouldn't even listen to new information.
meanings.sent4: Her uncle was a dogmatist when it came to politics, never willing to compromise.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dogmatists arguing loudly is hard to forget.

meanings.definition: Those who adhere strictly to a particular set of beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: The religious dogmatists followed every rule without question.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the dogmatists in the environmental movement.
meanings.sent3: The dogmatists' dedication to their cause was admirable, even if a bit extreme.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the designer was considered a dogmatist for his unique style.
meanings.sent5: The group of dogmatists stood firm in their beliefs, unwavering in the face of criticism.
